title: Rustc : segmentation fault

labels.name: I-crash
labels.description: Issue: The compiler crashes (SIGSEGV, SIGABRT, etc). Use I-ICE instead when the compiler panics.

body:
Hey, when I launch the compilation of this [projet](https://github.com/GuillaumeGomez/rust-GSL), rustc crashes with a segmentation fault :

``` Shell
> valgrind rustc --out-dir=lib src/rgsl.rs
==15335== Memcheck, a memory error detector
==15335== Copyright (C) 2002-2013, and GNU GPL'd, by Julian Seward et al.
==15335== Using Valgrind-3.10.0.SVN and LibVEX; rerun with -h for copyright info
==15335== Command: rustc --out-dir=lib src/rgsl.rs
==15335== 
==15335== Warning: client switching stacks?  SP change: 0xffefffa10 --> 0xffeb551a8
==15335==          to suppress, use: --max-stackframe=4892776 or greater
==15335== Syscall param read(buf) points to unaddressable byte(s)
==15335==    at 0x40194F7: read (syscall-template.S:81)
==15335==    by 0x4005E0C: open_verify.constprop.6 (dl-load.c:2099)
==15335==    by 0x4009101: _dl_map_object (dl-load.c:2504)
==15335==    by 0x400D601: openaux (dl-deps.c:63)
==15335==    by 0x400FFF3: _dl_catch_error (dl-error.c:187)
==15335==    by 0x400DD04: _dl_map_object_deps (dl-deps.c:254)
==15335==    by 0x400315C: dl_main (rtld.c:1742)
==15335==    by 0x4017564: _dl_sysdep_start (dl-sysdep.c:249)
==15335==    by 0x4004CF7: _dl_start (rtld.c:332)
==15335==    by 0x40012D7: ??? (in /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/ld-2.19.so)
==15335==    by 0x2: ???
==15335==    by 0xFFF0007A2: ???
==15335==  Address 0xffeb551c0 is on thread 1's stack
```

I use this version :

``` Shell
rustc 0.12.0-nightly (4d69696ff 2014-09-24 20:35:52 +0000)
```
